intro: Matelea harleyi, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants with milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance through its succulent leaves and stems. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive crown-like structure. Matelea harleyi plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies, due to its nectar-rich blooms.
